questions.question: Zoned decimal numbers use the following values as A=blank B=positive sign C=negative sign
Zoned decimal numbers store the sign on
Packed decimal numbers store the sign on
To get 1's complement of a binary you need to:
options: Substract highest possible value of that number of digits from the number
Substract the number to the highest possible value of that number of digits

questions.question: In floating point representation, the exponent has a excess method is:
options: The exponent is calculated by substracting the biased value
The exponent is calculated by adding the biased value (IEEE - 127 and IBM 64)

questions.question: What are the error types in computations?
options: Overflow, underflow, loss of significating digits, cancelation of trailing digits
Loss of trailing digits and Overflow
Loss of trailing digits, Overflow and Underflow, Rounding errors, Cancellation of significant digits

questions.question: What is the relative error?
options: |True value - computated value(including errors)| /  |computated value(including errors)|

questions.question: What is the absolute error?
options: |True value - computated value(including errors)| /  |computated value(including errors)|

questions.question: In Arithmetic shift:
options: Shift the sign bit, truncate extra bits shifted out, store 0 in empty positions
Do not shift the sign bit, truncate extra bits shifted out, store 0 in empty positions
Do not shift the sign bit, swap the truncate extra bits shifted to the start, store 0 in empty positions
Do not shift the sign bit, truncate extra bits shifted out, store 0 in empty position if shift left, else the same as sign bit

questions.question: In logical shift:
options: Shift the sign bit, truncate extra bits shifted out, store 0 in empty positions
Do not shift the sign bit, truncate extra bits shifted out, store 0 in empty positions
Shift the sign bit, swap the truncate extra bits shifted to the start, store 0 in empty positions
Do not shift the sign bit, truncate extra bits shifted out, store 0 in empty position if shift left, else the same as sign bit

questions.question: In Arithmetic shift, shifting left changes the value:
options: The value becomes 2^-n times of the original number
The value becomes 2^n times of the original number
The value becomes n times of the original number

questions.question: In Arithmetic shift, shifting right changes the value:
options: The value becomes 2^-n times of the original number
The value becomes 2 times of the original number
The value becomes 1/n times of the original number

questions.question: What's a rotation shift?
options: A type of arithmetic shift where the bits shifted out are circulated to the empty positions
A type of logical shift where the bits shifted out are circulated to the empty positions
A unique shifting operation where where the bits shifted out are circulated to the empty positions
